page.title: 13HOUSES IN GALGORM
page.content: In Galgorm Village there are five housing estates which are quite modern. In the estates the types are detached; semi_detached, bungalows, flats and terraced. There are two houses at Galgorm Corner which were once a Boys'School built in 1873 and a Girls' School built in 1878 by John Young of Galgorm Castle who died in 1915. In the middle of the village there are two lovely thatched houses which are also being preserved. Beyond these a housing estate is being built. A modern house is built for a family of four or five with two reception rooms, a kitchen, three bedrooms and a bathroom. Most of these houses have gardens front and back.
